hedline.hl1: On Location: Reading Your Way Around the City

abstract.p: Thomas Beller's Web site links Manhattan locations with essays, poems and stories associated with them; photo (S)

block.p: Thomas Beller, a writer in New York, is putting literature on the map. Mr. Beller's Neighborhood, a new Web site (www .mrbellersneighborhood.com), divides an aerial view of Manhattan into nine areas, then links essays, poems and stories to the locations where they are set If the viewer zooms in on the Upper East Side, for example, a red dot at 77th Street and Madison Avenue leads to W. H. Auden's poem ''In Schrafft's.'' Mr. Beller, author of the novel ''The Sleep-Over Artist,'' said the project, which was produced with the online magazine Word.com, was ''a narrative that sprawls in many directions.'' In other words, it's all over the map.
MATTHEW MIRAPAUL

Sites

www.lib.umich.edu/libhome/Documents.center /elec2000.html The government and elections page of the University of Michigan. An extensive collection of links to sites about issues, political parties, lobbying groups and candidates and even a site to get financial disclosure reports for politicians.
www.drummersweb.com A site for drummers, percussionists and cymbalists, with classified ads, manufacturers, news, festival information and links to sites on various kinds of drums.
www.pagat.com Descriptions of dozens of card games, including rummy, poker and bridge, of course, but also brag, elevator, manipulation, cucumber and spite and malice.
